discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
You could probably get thru the test just knowing the payload IDs for G.711u being 0 and G.729 being 18.

G.729 = 18
G.711u= 0
G.711a = 8
G.723 = 4
G.728 = 15

https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3551#page-32

Refer to the exhibit. A customer wants the SIP 200 OK shown to advertise codecs in the following order:
✑ G.729
✑ G.711u
✑ G.711a
✑ G.723

G.728 -

//IMG//
After correcting the codec preferences, what should the audio payload show in the SIP Traces?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
1024\87.2=11.74. A would be the closest match

comments.content: I think if you round it 1000/80=12.5, but if you want to be accurate, 1024x1024/87.2=12.036 which will be the same thing, that is closer to 12.

This is CAC question. Le'ts say we use 1 Mbps that is 1024. CUCM for g711 reduces 84 kbps from remaining bandwidth that was allocated. 1024/84 gives 12,19. This means CAC wouldn't allow 13th call to be placed, and options such as AAR could be triggered.

discussion.content: G.711 bandwidth per call should be 87.2 Kbps therefore i'd think the answer would be 11? what am i doing wrong?

questions.question_text:
A network administrator with ID0123456789 has determined that a WAN link between two Cisco UCM clusters supports only 1 Mbps of bandwidth for voice traffic.
How many calls does this link support if G.711 as the audio codec is used?

discussion.content: The correct Answer is A. I tested in my office, and 7821 without configured DN, is displaying "Unprovisioned". Auto-reg is disabled also.

Correct Answer:

A. Auto-registration is disabled on the Cisco Unified Communications Manager nodes, and the phone device does not have a DN configured.
Page Reference (English):
This issue is discussed in Chapter 17 of the Cisco Press guide on Page 399. The "unprovisioned" error message often occurs when auto-registration is disabled in Cisco Unified Communications Manager and the device does not have a directory number (DN) configured.

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct ansewer.

The question starts with " When a new SIP phone is registered to Cisco Unified Communications Manager"..........so phone was already registered. I think "unprovisioned" message comes when phone is unable to install last firmware . Answer could be: C

Selected Answer: A
Tested with 8861 and auto reg disabled. Assign the phone but don't put a DN on it, unprovisioned shown on phone.

Selected Answer: A
I agree with A

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
The Answer is A

Selected Answer: A
The correct Answer is A

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A. A SIP-configured phone without a DN configured on Line 1 will remain unprovisioned.
Should be A.
Answer should be A
The possible answer should be A, Unprovisioned error is mostly referring to DN, nothing to do with TFTP or firmware
Answer is A.

comments.content: In this answer alternate TFTP is mentioned not primary

discussion.content: D is the correct answer. ...which problem is a possible cause of the issue... The phone having the wrong TFTP will cause the issue.

Phone does not need latest firmware to register with cucm.
I searched some topics and found info that SIP phones require DN to register with cucm.
so it should be A.

comments.content: Update on further reading, it should be A
I believe auto-registration is mentioned in the question because with auto-registration the phone would be provided with a DN.

discussion.content: Correct is C . The phone is already configured but got getting registered, so not auto-registration issue
Answer is A

choices.D: The DHCP settings are set incorrectly and the phone does not have an alternate TFTP defined.
choices.C: The phone cannot download and install the latest firmware.
choices.A: Auto-registration is disabled on the Cisco Unified Communications Manager nodes and the phone device does not have a DN configured.
choices.B: The DN assigned to the phone is already in use by another SIP phone.
choices.E: The DN configuration for this phone is shared with an SCCP phone, which is not supported.

questions.question_text: When a new SIP phone is registered to Cisco Unified Communications Manager, it keeps failing and showing an `unprovisioned` error message in the phone display. Which problem is a possible cause of this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct. Since the Max Bitrate is only 40kbps, G722 (rtpmap:9) only goes down to 48kbps and G711 (rtpmap:0 ulaw/8 alaw) is 64kbps leaving only G729 (rtpmap:18).
A is correct

comments.content: Slushed is right. On this question you have a limitation of 40K for BW. G722 can use only 64k, 56K or 48K. So Answer is D

Refer to the exhibit. In this Cisco UCM setup configured for EARLY OFFER, what is the codec preference line in the initial SIP INVITE SDP?

choices.B: Set the SIPS URI Handling to True in CallManager Service Parameters.
choices.D: Define Cluster Fully Qualified Domain Name in Enterprise Parameters.
choices.A: Change the Destination Address to a Fully Qualified Domain Name on the SIP trunk.
choices.C: Define Cluster Fully Qualified Domain Name under Servers in Cisco UCM.
